content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

function extract_julia_code(md)
    # Initialize an empty string to store the extracted code
    code = ""

    # Iterate over each line of the markdown document
    for line in eachline(IOBuffer(md))
        # Check if the current line is a code fence
        if startswith(line, "```")
            # If it is a code fence, remove the ``` and any whitespace characters from the beginning and end of the line
            line = strip(replace(line, r"^```|^\s+", ""))

            # Check if there is already some code stored in the `code` variable
            if !isempty(code)
                # If so, add a newline to separate the code blocks
                code *= "\n"
            end

            # Add the extracted code to the `code` variable
            code *= line
        end
    end

    # Return the extracted code as a String
    return code
end
